title: 113_hr697
content: The Act is titled the "Three Kids Mine Remediation and Reclamation Act" and defines "Federal land" as the 948 acres within the Three Kids Mine Project Site. Key terms like "hazardous substance" and "pollutant or contaminant" are defined according to the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency, as defined by the Nevada Community Redevelopment Law, designates a Responsible Party to complete the Three Kids Mine Project Area according to the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency designates a Responsible Party to complete the Three Kids Mine Project Area, approved by the State of Nevada, for assessment, remediation, reclamation, and redevelopment. The "Three Kids Mine Project Site" encompasses approximately 1,262 acres of Federal and non-Federal land. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and the State refers to the State of Nevada. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will receive the Three Kids Mine Project Site, consisting of 1,262 acres of Federal and non-Federal land, within 90 days of meeting specified conditions. The Secretary of the Interior will convey all rights to the land to the Agency, subject to existing rights and laws. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will pay the fair market value for the Federal land being conveyed, determined by an appraisal conducted according to nationally recognized standards. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency will pay fair market value for the Federal land based on appraisals following national standards. The estimate for remediation and reclamation costs at the Three Kids Mine Project Site will be prepared by the Secretary. The Phase II environmental site assessment of the Three Kids Mine Project Site must be based on ASTM International Standard E-2137-06 (2011) for estimating costs and liabilities. Assessment requirements for Phase II environmental site assessment must comply with specified procedures. The Phase II environmental site assessment must adhere to ASTM International standards E-1527-05 and E-1903-11. The Secretary will consider cost information from the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, Responsible Party, and State for estimating costs. If there is a disagreement, parties will select experts to assist in making the final cost estimate. The Secretary will begin the cost estimates within 30 days of enacting the Act. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency or Responsible Party will reimburse appraisal costs. The fair market value of Federal land will be adjusted based on estimates of remediation and reclamation costs. The conveyance of Federal land is contingent on the execution of a mine remediation and reclamation agreement, with the Secretary's approval within 30 days of notification from the State. The mine remediation and reclamation agreement required for the conveyance of Federal land must be an enforceable consent order or agreement between the State and the Responsible Party, obligating the Responsible Party to perform the necessary remediation work at the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The Project Site must undergo remedial actions to protect human health and the environment from hazardous substances, in compliance with Federal, State, and local regulations. It includes provisions determined necessary by the State and the Henderson Redevelopment Agency, such as financial assurance for completing the remedy. Notification from the agency is required within 90 days of the conveyance. The Henderson Redevelopment Agency must notify the Secretary within 90 days of the conveyance for the Federal land withdrawal under the mine remediation agreement. The land is withdrawn from all public land laws for a 10-year period. The Bureau of Reclamation relinquishes withdrawals under public land laws if no longer needed, excluding the property no longer required. The Act allows for the immediate conveyance of Federal land and does not interfere with existing rights holders' use of water conveyance infrastructure. Additionally, adjustments to ACEC boundaries are permitted. SEC. 5 of the Act adjusts the boundary of the River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. SEC. 6 states that the Responsible Party and the State of Nevada are responsible for mine remediation and reclamation after the conveyance of land. The Act adjusts the boundary of the River Mountains Area of Critical Environmental Concern to exclude the Three Kids Mine Project Site. The Responsible Party and the State of Nevada are responsible for mine remediation and reclamation after the conveyance of land. If the terms of the agreement executed have not been met, the Secretary still has the responsibility to take necessary response actions to protect public health and the environment. This Act does not affect the obligation to comply with any environmental or public health law. SEC. 7. SOUTHERN NEVADA PUBLIC LANDS MANAGEMENT ACT. The Southern Nevada Public Land Management Act of 1998 does not apply to land conveyed under this Act.
